description: Construction of a part one and part three storey building to provide seven self contained units (two, one bedroom flats, three two bedroom flats and two studio flats) and two A2 (financial and professional services) units following demolition of existing flats and A3 restaurant; incorporating associated refuse and recycling, landscaping and cycle parking.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers 173-07B and 173-08 B unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the approved plans, details of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment', and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until the refuse and recycling and cycle storage facilities shown on the approved plan 173-07B have been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times, unless alternative arrangements are approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policy 2.10 'Waste Minimisation and Management' of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 2004, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, policy 7B of the Draft Ealing Management Development Plan Document (February 2013) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Prior to the commencement of the development, details in line with the criteria specified in SPG10 shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, including, as appropriate, the noise exposure category, the BS4142 rating noise and the predicted vibration levels.  The details shall also include the noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided and also mitigation of vibration.  Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential units and thereafter permanently retained.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policy 1.1 j of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The applicant shall submit to the local planning authority for approval prior to the commencement of development a scheme for providing fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms on The Uxbridge Road facade, the supply to be provided from the rear of the building at high level. The approved mitigation scheme shall be implemented in its entirety before any of the units are occupied.  Reason: To ensure that the amenities of occupiers are protected from the poor air quality in the vicinity.in accordance with policies 2.6, and 4.1 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 3 , policy 1.1 j of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.14 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding the approved plans and prior to the first occupation of any part of the development, full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved and in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, and in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy 4.5 and policies 7.4 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2011). | Before any part of the development hereby permitted is first occupied arrangements shall be agreed in writing with the local planning authority (legal agreement) and be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of disabled persons/Blue badge holders, no resident of the seven flats shall obtain a resident's parking permit (including visitors' permits) within any controlled parking zone which may be in force in the area at any time. The professional and legal fees incurred by the Council in drafting and completing the agreement shall be met by the applicant/owner.  Reason: To ensure that proposal does not exacerbate on-street parking pressure in the local controlled parking zone, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012) and policies 6.13 and 8.2 the London Plan (2011). | The rating noise level emitted from any proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policy 1.1 j of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The hours of business of the commercial part(s) of the building shall be restricted to the period 0800 - 2300hrs Mondays to Sundays.  REASON: Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policy 1.1 j of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Deliveries of goods to, and waste collections from the proposed development shall only take place during the period 0800 - 1800 hrs on Mondays to Saturdays and at no time on Sundays and Public Holidays.  REASON: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policy 1.1 j of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The insulation of the floor/ceiling between the commercial premises and the dwelling shall be sufficient to ensure that an acoustic standard not exceeding NR 25 Leq 5mins, (octaves) or NR 20 Leq 5mins, (one-third octaves) will be met inside a bedroom and NR 30 Leq,5mins (octaves), or NR 25 Leq,5mins (one-third octaves), inside a living room when noise is generated from the commercial use  REASON: Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policy 1.1 j of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The proposed windows in the east facing elevation approved shall contain only obscure glass as indicated on the approved plan 173-0B  Reason: To safeguard the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of adjoining properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policy 1.1 j of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding the approved plans, details of appropriate screening to the proposed balconies shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, prior to first occupation of any part of the development is commenced. Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: To safeguard the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of adjoining properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policy 1.1 j of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
